translation: The Changfang calendar only goes back to the fifth year of Chengsheng, when the state of Liang was cut off from the chronicles of Yanlun and Wang Daogui, and then to the second year of Shaotai, when the name was changed to the first year of Taiping.

source_sentence: 曆中但紀後號不載前名。

source_sentence: 八吉祥神呪經一卷(或無神字)

translation: One volume of the Sutra of the Eight Yang Dhāraṇīs (also known as the New Translation of the Sutra of the Eight Yang Dhāraṇīs), translated by the Western Jin Tripiṭaka, Zhu Faju (second translation), one volume of the Liang Funan Tripiṭaka, Saṃghabhara (fourth translation), and one volume of the Sutra of the Names of the Eight Buddhas, translated by the Sui Tianzhu Tripiṭaka, Jñānagupta, and others (fifth translation).

translation: The right two sūtras have the same text and are translated differently (Mo Bian first and last are slightly different in breadth and width).

translation: The Great Tang Tianzang Sanzang Baosiwei Translation (New Compilation of Entries, First Translation) One Fascicle of the Sutra on the Merit of Bathing Images, Great Tang Sanzang Yijing Translation (New Compilation of Entries, Second Translation) The right two sūtras are the same in their translation (the latter being slightly broader).

source_sentence: 校量數珠功德經一卷
translation: Xuanqiancu zhue gongde jing (The Sutra of the Merit of the Bathing Image) One volume

translation: The Great Tang Tianzang Sanzang Baosiwei Translation (New Compilation and Entry Record No. 1 Translation) One volume of the Sutra on the Merit of Counting Pearls (Inner Cloud Sutra on the Merit of Counting Pearls in the Manshushī Curtain Collection) The Great Tang Sanzang Yijing Translation (New Compilation and Entry Record No. 2 Translation) The two sūtras on the right are the same text and different translations.

source_sentence: 上二十九經二十九卷同帙。
translation: The above twenty-nine sūtras and twenty-nine volumes are in the same volume.

source_sentence: 不空羂索神變真言經三十卷三帙
translation: Bukong juansuo shenchang zhenyan jing (Bukong juansuo shenchang zhenyan jing) 30 fascicles in 3 books

source_sentence: 大唐南天竺三藏菩提流志譯(新編入錄當第四譯)不空羂索呪經一卷隋天竺三藏闍那崛多等譯(第一譯)不空羂索神呪心經一卷大唐三藏玄奘譯(出內典錄第二譯)右二經同本異譯(是前大經序品三藏流志先譯一卷名不空羂索呪心經尋本未獲)。
translation: The first translation is by the Sui Tianzang Sanzang Jñānagupta and others (the first translation), and the second translation is by the Great Tang Sanzang Xuanzang (from the second translation in the Inner Canon).

source_sentence: 不空羂索陀羅尼自在王呪經三卷(亦云不空羂索心呪王經)大唐天后代天竺三藏寶思惟譯(新編入錄第一譯)不空羂索陀羅尼經一卷(一名普門)大唐天后代北天竺婆羅門李無諂譯(新編入錄第二譯)右二經同本異譯(此是梵本經抄非是全部與前三經同名異本)。
translation: The three volumes of the Dhāraṇī of the Amoghapāśa Dhāraṇī are also called the Amoghapāśa Dhāraṇī of the Mind (the first translation in the New Catalogue of Entries), and the one volume of the Amoghapāśa Dhāraṇī (a universal translation) is translated by Li Wuling, a Brahmin of Northern India, from the Heavenly Lineage of the Great Tang Dynasty (the second translation in the New Catalogue of Entries).

source_sentence: 千眼千臂觀世音菩薩陀羅尼神呪經二卷(或一卷)大唐總持寺沙門釋智通譯(拾遺編入第一譯)千手千眼觀世音菩薩姥陀羅尼身經一卷(或云千臂千眼)大唐南天竺三藏菩提流志譯(新編入錄第二譯)右二經同本異譯(其初譯本貝葉交錯文少失次)。
translation: Thousand Eyes, Thousand Arms Avalokitêśvara Dhāraṇī Sutra, Two Fascicle (or One Fascicle) Translation by Śāriputra of the Temple of Zongchi, Great Tang (Collected Documents, First Translation) One Fascicle of the Thousand Hands, Thousand Eyes Avalokitêśvara Dhāraṇī Body Sutra (or Thousand Arms, Thousand Eyes) Translation by Bodhiruci, Tripiṭaka of Southern India, Great Tang (Second Translation in the New Catalogue) The right two sūtras are the same text and different translations (the first translation has a few errors in the shell and leaves, and the text is inferior).

source_sentence: 千手千眼觀世音菩薩廣大圓滿無礙大悲心陀羅尼經一卷大唐西天竺沙門伽梵達摩譯(拾遺編單本)右此心經雖是單本隨前身經編之於此。
translation: The Dhāraṇī of the Thousand Hands, Thousand Eyes Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva's Vast, Wholly Perfect, Unimpeded, Greatly Compassionate Heart is a one-volume translation by the monk Gavāṃpati Dharma of Western India from the Tang Dynasty (a single copy of the gleanings compilation).

source_sentence: 觀世音菩薩祕密藏神呪經一卷
translation: Guanshiyin pusa mimi zang shenzhou jing one volume

source_sentence: 大唐天后代于闐三藏實叉難陀譯(新編入錄第一譯)觀世音菩薩如意摩尼陀羅尼經一卷大唐天竺三藏寶思惟譯(新編入錄第二譯)上九經十二卷同帙。
translation: The Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva's Wishful Mind Dhāraṇī Sutra, One Volume, Translated by the Ütānese Tripiṭaka of India (New Translation of the Record of Entries), Twelve Fascicles of the Nine Sutras (New Translation of the Record of Entries), Twelve Fascicles in One Volume.

source_sentence: 觀自在菩薩如意心陀羅尼呪經一卷
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Wishful Thinking of the Bodhisattva of Spontaneous Contemplation, One Volume

source_sentence: 大唐三藏義淨譯(新編入錄第三譯)如意輪陀羅尼經一卷大唐天竺三藏菩提流志譯(新編入錄第四譯)右四經同本異譯(上四本經雖有廣略據其梵本並譯未盡義淨出者共法最略)。
translation: A translation of the Dhāraṇī of the Wish-Fulfilling Wheel in one volume (the third translation in the New Catalogue of Entries), translated by Bodhiruci (the fourth translation in the New Catalogue of Entries), of the four scriptures on the right side of the same text (although the above four scriptures are extensive and abbreviated, according to their concurrent translation into the Sanskrit text, the one produced by Yijing is the most abbreviated in terms of the common dharma).

source_sentence: 文殊師利根本一字陀羅尼經一卷(亦名一字呪王經)大唐天后代天竺三藏寶思惟譯(新編入錄第一譯)曼殊室利菩薩呪藏中一字呪王經一卷大唐天后代三藏義淨譯(新編入錄第二譯)右二經同本異譯。
translation: Wenshushiliguan yizi tuoluoni jing, one volume (also known as yizi zhouwang jing) translated by Bao Siwei, a tripiṭaka of the descendants of the Great Tang Dynasty (the first translation in the New Catalogue of Entrances); and manshushiliguo shizang zhong yizi zhouwang jing, one volume translated by Yijing, a tripiṭaka of the descendants of the Great Tang Dynasty (the second translation in the New Catalogue of Entrances).

source_sentence: 十二佛名神呪經一卷
translation: Twelve Buddha Names: A Spiritual Dhāraṇī Sutra, One Volume

source_sentence: 隋天竺三藏闍那崛多等譯(第一譯)稱讚如來功德神呪經一卷大唐三藏義淨譯(新編入錄第二譯)右二經同本異譯(其五千五百佛名經第一卷初十二佛號與前十二佛名同而不別又十二佛名經舊錄為單本新勘為重譯)。
translation: Sui Tianzang Sanzang Jñānagupta et al. Translation (first translation) Praise the Tathāgata for His Merits Dhāraṇī One Fascicle Great Tang Sanzang Yijing Translation (second translation in the new compilation) Right Two Sutras in the Same Source Different Translations (the first volume of the Sutra of the Names of the Five Thousand and Five Hundred Buddhas, the first twelve Buddha names are the same as the first twelve Buddha names, but not different.)

source_sentence: 孔雀王呪經一卷(亦名大金色孔雀王經并結界場法具)姚秦三藏鳩摩羅什譯(第四譯)大金色孔雀王呪經一卷失譯(今附秦錄拾遺編入第五譯)佛說大金色孔雀王呪經一卷失譯(亦附秦錄拾遺編入第六譯)孔雀王呪經二卷梁扶南三藏僧伽婆羅譯(第七譯)大孔雀呪王經三卷大唐三藏義淨於東都內道場譯(新編入錄第八譯)右五經同本異譯(新舊八譯五存三闕前六文略後二稍廣)。
translation: The Peacock Sutra, one volume (also known as the Great Golden Peacock Sutra and the Dharma implements for the site of the boundary), was translated by the Yao-Qin Tripiṭaka Kumārajīva (fourth translation), the Great Golden Peacock Sutra, one volume, was lost (now compiled into the fifth translation with the Qin Record Collection), the Great Golden Peacock Sutra, one volume, was lost (also compiled into the sixth translation with the Qin Record Collection), the Peacock Sutra, two volumes, was translated by the Liang Funan Tripiṭaka Saṃghabhara (seventh translation), the Great Peacock Sutra, three volumes, was translated by the Great Tang Tripiṭaka Yijing at the inner road site in the Eastern capital (newly compiled into the eighth translation), and the right five sūtras were translated from the same source (the first six texts are omitted in the old and new eight translations, while the last two are slightly expanded).

source_sentence: 上十一經十四卷同帙。
translation: The above eleven sūtras are in the same fourteen volume set.

source_sentence: 陀羅尼集經十二卷
translation: Dhāraṇī Collection Sutra, 12 volumes

source_sentence: 大唐中天竺三藏阿地瞿多譯(出大周錄單重合譯)右出金剛大道場經大明呪藏之少分也。
translation: The translation of the Atikūṭa Tripiṭaka of Central India from the Tang (from the Dazhou lu, a single, double translation) is right out of the lesser part of the Daming zhouzang collection of the Jingang daochang jing.

source_sentence: 撮要而譯(此集之中大般若呪經等有別行者錄不具顯人多生疑恐非正典今為除疑故別條末列之如後)。
translation: It is a summary translation (there are individual practices in this collection, such as the Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra, that are not fully disclosed in the records, and people often have doubts that it is not the correct scripture.)

source_sentence: 第一卷佛部卷上(大神力陀羅尼釋迦佛頂三昧陀羅尼品)第二卷佛部卷下(初畫一切佛頂像法次有二十六印并呪諸佛呪印法第三阿彌陀佛大思惟經序分呪印法并說持誦得往生事及數珠法第四大金輪陀羅尼第五拔折囉功能法相品)第三卷(摩訶般若波羅蜜多心經佛在舍衛國說大般若理趣中呪及般若心呪皆在此中於中第十二印并呪名般若無盡藏注云是一印呪筏梨耶思蠅伽法師譯卷末復有大輪金剛陀羅尼若誦此呪即當入壇及得用印不成盜法)第四卷觀世音卷上(十一面觀世音神呪經)第五卷觀世音卷中(初有二印及呪千囀觀世音菩薩呪次有六印及呪觀世音雜呪印第三十二臂觀世音菩薩一印并呪第四不空羂索觀世音四印并呪第五畫觀世音像法第六觀世音毘俱知菩薩三昧法印呪品也)第六卷觀世音等諸菩薩卷下(初阿耶揭唎婆觀世音菩薩法印呪唐云馬頭第二諸大菩薩法會印呪品大勢至菩薩文殊師利菩薩彌勒菩薩地藏菩薩普賢菩薩虛空藏菩薩等並有印呪法)第七卷金剛部卷上(初金剛藏大威神力三昧法印呪品第二金剛藏眷屬法印呪品諸眷屬金剛說呪并印)第八卷金剛部卷中(初金剛阿蜜哩多軍茶利菩薩自在神力呪印品第二拔折羅吒呵娑印呪法唐云大笑金剛)第九卷金剛部卷下(初金剛烏樞沙摩法印呪品唐云不淨潔金剛即火頭金剛是第二天青面金剛呪法)第十卷諸天卷上(初摩利支天經第二功德天法中天竺國菩提寺僧阿難律木叉師迦葉師等於法行寺翻流行於唐國)第十一卷諸天卷下(諸天等獻佛助成三昧法印呪品大梵摩天帝釋摩醯首羅四天王日天月天星宿天地天火天閻羅天一切龍王呪印并祈雨法那羅延天乾闥婆緊那羅摩詆囉伽孔雀王師子王伽嚕荼大辯天神王焰摩檀陀水天風天阿修羅王遮文茶天法一切毘那夜迦法一切藥叉法一切羅剎法　右大梵摩天等皆獻呪印)第十二卷(諸佛大陀羅尼都會道場印呪品是灌頂普集會壇法)十一面觀世音神呪經一卷(周宇文氏天竺三藏耶舍崛多等譯第一譯)十一面神呪心經一卷大唐三藏玄奘譯(出內典錄第二譯)右二經。
translation: (1) First, the Buddhadhātu Chapter, first (The Dhāraṇī of Great Spiritual Powers, the Śākyamuni Samādhi Chapter); second, the Buddhadhātu Chapter, second (First, the Dhāraṇī of All Buddha Images, second, twenty-six seals, and the Dhāraṇī of All Buddha Spells, third, the Dhāraṇī of Amitâbha Buddha's Great Contemplation Sutra, third, the Dhāraṇī of the Great Golden Wheel, and fifth, the Dhāraṇī of the Function of the Dharma-Sign of Bazhara.

source_sentence: 與前陀羅尼集經第四卷。
translation: They are the same as the preceding Dhāraṇī Collection Sutra, vol. 4.

source_sentence: 十一面神呪經。
translation: The Eleven-Faced Spiritual Dhāraṇī Sutra.

source_sentence: 同本異譯(而集經中印法稍廣)。
translation: It's the same text in a different translation (but the scripture of the collection contains a slightly broader range of precepts).

source_sentence: 摩利支天經一卷(或加小字)
translation: Sutra of the Mārīcī Devānām-Indra (or with small letters)

source_sentence: 失譯(今附梁錄拾遺編入)
translation: Lost in translation (now appended to the compilation of gleanings from the Liang Catalogue)

source_sentence: 右一經是集經第十卷初摩利支天經少分異譯。
translation: The right one is a partial variant translation of the First Maricī Celestial Sutra from the tenth volume of the Collected Buddhist Texts.

source_sentence: 呪五首經一卷
translation: One volume of the Sutra of the Five Heads of the Dhāraṇī

source_sentence: 大唐三藏玄奘譯(出翻經圖單重合譯)呪五首者(能滅諸罪千囀陀羅尼呪一六字陀羅尼呪二七俱胝佛所說神呪三隨一切如來意神呪四觀自在菩薩隨心呪五其千囀呪亦有別寫以為一經既在此中故不別出大周錄中分為五經者非也)。
translation: The translation by the Great Tang Tripiṭaka Xuanzang (out of the sūtra translation chart, a single, double translation) is a thousand sins-eliminating dhāraṇī (a six-syllable dhāraṇī, a Dhāraṇī of seven calluses, a Dhāraṇī of seven calluses, a Dhāraṇī of seven calluses, a Dhāraṇī of three calluses, a Dhāraṇī of four calluses of the Bodhisattva who observes the wishes of the Tathāgatas, and a Dhāraṇī of five calluses, which is not separately classified into five sūtras in the Dazhou lu).

source_sentence: 千囀陀羅尼觀世音菩薩呪經一卷
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Thousand Emblems Avalokitêśvara Bodhisattva Dhāraṇī, One Fascicle

source_sentence: 大唐總持寺沙門釋智通譯(拾遺編入第二譯)右千囀呪二首。
translation: Translated by Śrī Ji-tong, an ascetic of the Zongji Temple in the Tang Dynasty (compiled from the Gleanings into the Second Translation) Two Thousand Avalokitêśvara Dhāraṇīs on the Right.

source_sentence: 與上集經第五卷初千囀觀世音呪。
translation: They are the same as the thousand-vehicle Avalokitêśvara dhāraṇī at the beginning of the fifth volume of the above collection of sūtras.

source_sentence: 及雜呪中千囀陀羅尼。
translation: The Dhāraṇī of the Thousand Arches in the Sutra of the Collection and the Thousand Arches in the Miscellaneous Dhāraṇīs.

source_sentence: 同本異譯。
translation: It's the same text in a different translation.

source_sentence: 六字神呪經一卷(或云六字呪法)
translation: Six Syllable Dhāraṇī in One Fascicle (Or Six Syllable Dhāraṇī)

source_sentence: 大唐天后代天竺三藏菩提流志譯(新編入錄第四譯)右一經。
translation: Translated by Bodhiruci (New Compilation of Entries, Fourth Translation) from the Tianzang Tianzang Tripiṭaka of the Later T'ang dynasty, Right One Sutra.

source_sentence: 與上集經第六卷中文殊師利菩薩呪法。
translation: It's the same as the Mañjuśrī-bodhisattva spell in the sixth volume of the above collection of sūtras.

source_sentence: 及呪五首經六字陀羅尼。
translation: The six-syllable dhāraṇī of the Sutra of Mañjuśrī and the Dhāraṇī of the Five Heads of the Dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 并雜呪中六字陀羅尼呪。
translation: It is also a six-syllable dhāraṇī from the Mādhyamaka Dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 同本異譯。
translation: The same text is translated differently.

source_sentence: 七俱胝佛大心准提陀羅尼經一卷
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Great Essence of the Seven Cornelian Buddhas: One Fascicle

source_sentence: 大唐中天竺三藏地婆訶羅譯(出大周錄第一譯)七俱胝佛母准泥大明陀羅尼經一卷大唐南天竺三藏金剛智譯(新編入錄第二譯)右二經同本異譯(比於舊經新者稍廣然據梵文譯仍未盡呪五首中及雜呪內惟獨譯呪更無餘法)。
translation: The first translation from the Dazhou lu of the Tripiṭaka of the Central India of the Great Tang (the first translation from the Dazhou lu) and the first translation from the Jingangzhi lu of the Tripiṭaka of the Southern India of the Great Tang (the second translation from the new compilation into the lu) are the two sūtras in the same text and in different translations (the new one is somewhat broader than the old one, but according to the Sanskrit translation it is still not exhaustive of the five sūtras and the miscellaneous sūtras, which are only solo translations, leaving nothing else).

source_sentence: 上九經二十卷二帙(上帙七卷下帙十三)。
translation: The first nine sūtras are in twenty volumes and two parts (the first seven and the second thirteen).

source_sentence: 觀自在菩薩隨心呪經一卷(亦云多唎心經)大唐總持寺沙門釋智通譯(新編入錄)右此觀自在隨心呪。
translation: Guanzizai pusa suixinzhou jing (also known as the Tārali xinzhou jing) 1 volume (also known as the Tārali xinzhou jing) Translated by Śrī Ji-tong, a monk at Zongji Temple, Datang (newly compiled and recorded) Right This is the Guanzizai suixinzhou jing.

source_sentence: 前呪五首經。
translation: The preceding spell is one of five major spells in the Avalokitêśvara Dhāraṇī Sutra.

source_sentence: 及雜呪經中觀世音初隨心呪。
translation: This is the first Avalokitêśvara initial follow-through spell from the Avalokitêśvara mahāyāna sūtra and the fifth from the Mādhyamaka mahāyāna sūtra.

source_sentence: 并集經第五。
translation: It is also the fifth in the collection of sūtras.

source_sentence: 並先譯出故編於此。
translation: They were first translated and are therefore compiled here.

source_sentence: 種種雜呪經一卷(或無經字)
translation: A Variety of Mixed Dhāraṇīs in One Fascicle (or without the sūtras)

source_sentence: 周宇文氏天竺三藏闍那崛多譯(拾遺編入單重合譯)雜呪總二十三首(法華經內呪六首旋塔滅罪陀羅尼。
translation: Zhou Uwen's Tianzhu Tripiṭaka, translated by Jñānagupta (compiled from the Gleanings into a single, compound translation), contains a total of twenty-three māras (six māras within the Lotus Sutra, the Dhāraṇī for Extinguishing Sins at the Tower of Whirling, and one for welcoming the buddhas at the end of life).

source_sentence: 一禮拜滅罪命終諸佛來迎呪。
translation: One is a prostrating dhāraṇī for extinguishing sins and one is for welcoming the buddhas at the end of one's life.

source_sentence: 一供養三寶呪。
translation: One for making offerings to the three treasures.

source_sentence: 一觀世音懺悔呪。
translation: One Avalokitêśvara Repentance Dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 一金剛呪蛇呪。
translation: One Vajragarbha-snake dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 一生禪安隱呪。
translation: A spell for the pacifying of life meditation.

source_sentence: 一呪腫呪。
translation: A spell for treating tumors.

source_sentence: 一金剛呪治惡鬼病。
translation: One vajra dhāraṇī for curing bad spirits.

source_sentence: 一千囀陀羅尼。
translation: A thousand sūtras (dhāraṇīs).

source_sentence: 一觀世音隨心呪。
translation: One Avalokitêśvara Dhāraṇī for calming the mind.

source_sentence: 四首七俱胝佛神呪。
translation: Four first seven corpuscles Buddha spells.

source_sentence: 一隨一切如來意神呪。
translation: One that follows the wishes of all the tathāgatas.

source_sentence: 一與呪五首中者同本六字陀羅尼呪。
translation: One is a six-syllable dhāraṇī of the same origin as the five heads of the dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 一歸依三寶呪一)。
translation: One is a refuge to the Three Treasures spell (1).

source_sentence: 佛頂尊勝陀羅尼經一卷
translation: Foding zunsheng tuoluoni jing one roll

source_sentence: 大唐朝散郎杜行顗奉制譯(出大周錄第一譯)佛頂最勝陀羅尼經一卷大唐中天竺三藏地婆訶羅譯(拾遺編入第二譯)佛頂尊勝陀羅尼經一卷大唐罽賓沙門佛陀波利譯(出大周錄第三譯)最勝佛頂陀羅尼淨除業障經一卷大唐中天竺三藏地婆訶羅於東都再譯(拾遺編入第四譯)佛頂尊勝陀羅尼經一卷(或加呪字)大唐三藏義淨譯(新編入錄第五譯)右五經同本異譯。
translation: The Most Excellent Dhāraṇī of the Buddha-Peak for Cleansing the Karmic Hindrances One Fascicle Translated by Dīpahāra, the Tripiṭaka of Central India, Great Tang (Collected and Incorporated into the Second Translation) The Most Excellent Dhāraṇī of the Buddha-Peak for Cleansing the Karmic Hindrances One Fascicle Translated by Buddhapālī, the Shamon of Kāśapin, Great Tang (Collected and Incorporated into the Third Translation) The Most Excellent Dhāraṇī of the Buddha-Peak for Cleansing the Karmic Hindrances One Fascicle Translated by Dīpahāra, the Tripiṭaka of Central India, Great Tang (Collected and Incorporated into the Fourth Translation)

translation: 無量門微密持經一卷(一名成道降魔得一切智經)吳月支優婆塞支謙譯(第一譯)出生無量門持經一卷(或云新微密持經)東晉天竺三藏佛陀跋陀羅譯(第五譯)阿難陀目佉尼呵離陀經一卷(或云出無量門持經)宋天竺三藏求那跋陀羅譯(拾遺編入第六譯)無量門破魔陀羅尼經一卷(或直云破魔陀羅尼經)宋西域沙門功德直共玄暢譯(第七譯)阿難陀目佉尼訶離陀隣尼經一卷元魏天竺三藏佛陀扇多譯(第八譯)舍利弗陀羅尼經一卷梁扶南三藏僧伽婆羅譯(第九譯)一向出生菩薩經一卷隋天竺三藏闍那崛多等譯(第十譯)出生無邊門陀羅尼經一卷大唐至相寺沙門釋智嚴譯(新編入錄第十一譯)右八經同本異譯(長房等錄中覺賢經數更有新微密持經一卷即是出生無量門持經是功德賢經數復有出無量門持經一卷即是阿難陀目佉尼訶離陀經是既是重載故不別存新舊十一譯三譯闕本)。

translation: The Tang Tripiṭaka Xuanzang Translation (from the First Translation of the Internal Canonical Record), the Dhāraṇī Sutra of the Fine Arm Indicating Block in One Volume, and the Translation by the Yutian Tripiṭaka of the Great Tang Dynasty, the Second Translation of the New Compilation and Entry Record (from the Old Record to the Second Translation), the two sutras on the right are the same text and different translations (the former translation of the Sutra of the Fine Arm Indicating Block is a single text, and the new one is a retranslation).

source_sentence: 上十七經十七卷同帙。
translation: The above seventeen sūtras are composed of seventeen volumes in the same book.

translation: One volume of the Wuyijie chishi famen jing (a Wuyijie jing) was translated by the Qifuqin monk Shi Shengjian (the first translation), and one volume of the Zhunsheng pusa suowen yiqie fenbie wuliangmen tuoluoni jing (the third translation) were translated by the Gaoqi householder Wan Tianyi (the first and last three translations and one missing translation).

This Deathbed Injunction was recorded in the old records as being mostly in the lesser vehicle vinaya or in the scriptures of the lesser vehicle.) The present translation of the Deathbed Injunction by the Master of the True Truth is a translation of the Deathbed Injunction that explains much about the lesser teachings of the greater vehicle and is therefore transposed here.

Now, we examine the text and principle and compile them in the greater vehicle, fearing that the vehicle will reach the truth.

source_sentence: 九十七部五百一十八卷五十帙。
translation: There are ninety-seven sections, five hundred and eighteen volumes, and fifty books.

source_sentence: 菩薩阿毘達磨有其二類。
translation: There are two kinds of bodhisattva abhidharma.

source_sentence: 一者解釋契經二者詮法體相。
translation: One is an explanation of the scriptures, and the other is an explanation of the essence and characteristics of the Dharma.

translation: The older record contains and compiles a mixture of them.

translation: Those who explain the sutras are listed in the previous section.

translation: The one that explains the nature of the Dharma is compiled at the end.

source_sentence: 庶無糅雜覽者易知。

translation: The Mahāprajñāpāramitā-śāstra is a hundred volumes (or one hundred and ten or seventy volumes and ten books) translated by the Yaoqin Tripiṭaka Kumārajīva, a single copy of the Mahāprajñāpāramitā-sūtra (the Dharma teacher Sh said that if it had been fully translated, there would have been a thousand volumes, and the Qin people's knowledge would have been weak, so it was omitted, and ten percent was preserved in one).

source_sentence: 今入寶積在第四十七會(論序記云魏興和三年歲次辛酉九月朔旦庚子之日烏萇國人剎利王種三藏法師毘目智仙中天竺國婆羅門人瞿曇流支護法大士驃騎大將軍開府儀同三司御史中尉勃海高仲密愛法之人沙門曇林道俗相假於鄴城內在金華寺譯四千九百九十七字諸錄皆云菩提留支譯者誤也今依序記為正)。
translation: The preface to the treatise states that in the third year of the reign of Wei's reign, on the day of the ninth moon of the month of Xingyou, the Tripiṭaka Master Bhīmu Zhixian, a native of Wudao, a native of Brahmā, a Gautama lucid protector of the Dharma, a great vajra general, an army commander, a director of the three divisions of the imperial court, and a lieutenant of the imperial court, Bohai Gao Zhongmi, a lover of the Dharma, an ascetic, Tanyin Daoxuan, translated the 4,997-word work at Jinhua Temple in the vicinity of the city, which was incorrectly recorded as a translation by Bodhiruci.

translation: Yuan Wei Tianzhu Sanzang Bimu Zhixian et al.
